content.description: Slightly more challenging than its neighbor Fitness to the right. Make Crimpy face climbing moves to the top of the Gym Boulder. The top out is slightly trickier than Fitness also.
content.protection: Pads, spotter. Watch the flake in the ground!
content.location: 5-6 feet left to the start of Fitnes and about 3 feet right of Squat. Stand between the pointy flake in the ground and the wall to start.

content.description:
This problem adds one more move into

Squat

and begins on the next horizontal crack down from the starting holds on that problem. This is a much more logical place to start and it makes an already good problem better! This is a technical, sequential boulder problem. If you like tenuous face climbing on tiny footholds, you'll like this problem.

NB: I don't think this low start adds much in terms of difficulty but Chris Dorrity's guidebook gives it V6, so I'll respect that.

Located kind of in the middle of the Gym boulder.  Start on two obvious small crimps and make a hard move up to a good edge.  Follow a couple of more sloping edges to a thought provoking top out.  May feel soft if you are taller.
content.location: Around the corner from the slave driver boulder.  This boulder is not free standing and is pretty long.  Look for a huge "Looking Glass" like boulder up above.

content.description: Sit start on the face at a low horizontal slot. Work out right to the arete and climb to the top using edges and jugs.
content.location: The Gym, Slave Driver Area. This is a long vertical face against the hillside.

content.description: Start on the arete, same holds as Prickly Pear.  Traverse left and up to gain the smalle corner/flake feature.  Top out.
Stand Start face climb that follows nice horizontal crimps and good hand-foot matching. Try not to grab the tree on the top out, which is barely a little slopey/committing.
content.location: On the Gym Boulder in the Slave Driver Area, approximately 3-4 feet right of the large flake sticking out of the ground. Start at the horizontal flake and move up and left.

content.description: Start on the far left side of the wall, matched on the detached flake.  Traverse the entire wall following the obvious horizontal seam around 10'up.  Top out on Prickly Pear
content.protection: Put a pad over the flake in the middle of the landing zone. Generally good landing.
